title: Retell Lecture #1
promptText: How can a journalist craft questions that unravel narratives like the one presented here? The key lies in knowing what to ask and from whom. It's crucial to recognize that every piece of journalism requires a trifecta of sourcing. Picture the reporting process as a triangle: one side involves official sources, individuals with titles and expertise who provide the concrete numbers and precise answers to fundamental journalistic inquiries—how much, how many, where, when, and who. On another side, you have overview sources—academics, consultants, and authors—who aren't directly tied as stakeholders but offer a broader perspective on the subject matter. However, the third side of this trifecta—unofficial sources—possesses a unique power: the individual's insight. This is where you uncover the "why," understanding the consequences of an event, trend, phase, or idea on a personal level and what it signifies to those impacted by it. So, how do you discover the valuable information, figuring out what's interesting from what's just talk? You ask unexpected questions. To establish that intricate and delicate human connection, you treat each subject's story with reverence. Recognize that an anecdote is like vital oxygen, breathing life into a narrative of facts and data, infusing it with vibrancy and humanity. Ultimately, it's about valuing and understanding the narratives of each subject, seeking out the profound and impactful stories that resonate at a deeper, soulful level.
promptMediaUrl: /asset/Offline_Practice_Test Pearson Model/Part 1_Speaking and Writing_PTE Academic Offline Practice Test/Prompts & Sample Responses/Prompts/2 Retell Lecture/Retell Lecture_Question 1/Retell Lecture_Question 1_P.mp3

title: Read Aloud — Artificial Intelligence Ethics
promptText: The development of artificial intelligence systems raises important ethical questions about accountability, transparency, and potential bias in automated decision-making processes that affect millions of people worldwide.

title: Read Aloud — Global Trade Patterns
promptText: International trade agreements have transformed economic relationships between nations, enabling the movement of goods, services, and capital across borders while raising concerns about labor standards and environmental protection.

title: Read Aloud — Neuroscience Research
promptText: Recent advances in neuroimaging technology have allowed researchers to observe brain activity in unprecedented detail, revealing complex patterns of neural connectivity that underlie cognitive functions and emotional responses.

title: Read Aloud — Sustainable Agriculture
promptText: Regenerative farming practices focus on rebuilding soil health, increasing biodiversity, and sequestering carbon, offering a promising approach to address both food security and climate change simultaneously.

title: Read Aloud — Educational Technology
promptText: Digital learning platforms have expanded access to education globally, though research suggests that effective implementation requires careful consideration of pedagogy, student engagement, and equitable access to technology.

title: Read Aloud — Biodiversity Conservation
promptText: Protected areas and wildlife corridors play a crucial role in maintaining biodiversity by providing habitats for endangered species and allowing genetic exchange between isolated populations.

title: Read Aloud — Financial Technology
promptText: Blockchain technology and digital currencies are reshaping financial systems, offering new possibilities for secure transactions, decentralized finance, and cross-border payments without traditional intermediaries.

title: Read Aloud — Public Health Infrastructure
promptText: Strong healthcare systems require adequate funding, trained personnel, and reliable supply chains to deliver preventive care, respond to emergencies, and address health disparities within communities.

title: Read Aloud — Space Exploration
promptText: Robotic missions to Mars and beyond have revealed valuable data about planetary formation, the potential for past life, and resources that could support future human exploration of the solar system.

title: Read Aloud — Workplace Innovation
promptText: The transition to hybrid work models has prompted organizations to rethink office design, collaboration tools, and performance metrics, balancing flexibility with organizational culture and productivity goals.

title: Read Aloud — Health Advisory 1
promptText: In South Australia, most individuals with COVID-19 experience mild illness and recover without requiring hospital care. Public health measures, including vaccination and timely testing, continue to reduce severe outcomes.

title: Read Aloud — Renewable Energy 2
promptText: Wind and solar energy have become more cost-effective over the past decade, driving a significant shift in how electricity is generated and distributed across modern grids.

title: Read Aloud — Marine Ecosystems 3
promptText: Coral reefs support a vast array of marine life, yet they are increasingly threatened by rising ocean temperatures, acidification, and human activity near coastal regions.

title: Read Aloud — Behavioral Science 4
promptText: Researchers have observed that small changes in choice architecture can nudge people toward healthier decisions without restricting freedom of choice.

title: Read Aloud — Urban Mobility 5
promptText: Cities investing in reliable public transportation often see reduced congestion, improved air quality, and greater access to employment opportunities for residents.

title: Read Aloud — Learning Strategies 6
promptText: Active recall and spaced repetition are evidence-based strategies shown to improve long-term retention compared to passive review techniques.

title: Read Aloud — Climate Adaptation 7
promptText: Adaptation strategies, such as floodplain restoration and heat-resilient infrastructure, can mitigate climate risks while delivering co-benefits to communities.

title: Read Aloud — Digital Privacy 8
promptText: As digital services expand, organizations must implement transparent data policies and robust security practices to maintain public trust.

title: Read Aloud — Nutrition Guidelines 9
promptText: A balanced diet emphasizes whole grains, lean proteins, fruits, and vegetables, while limiting added sugars, saturated fats, and sodium.

title: Read Aloud — Cultural Heritage 10
promptText: Preserving cultural heritage sites helps communities maintain identity, foster tourism, and educate future generations about shared history.

title: Summarize Group Discussion — Data Privacy 3
promptText: Participants discuss the impact of new data privacy regulations on app analytics and user experience. Summarize concerns and proposed solutions.

title: Summarize Group Discussion — University Funding 4
promptText: The committee explores funding allocations for research labs versus student services. Summarize arguments and any prioritization outcome.

title: Summarize Group Discussion — Healthy Canteen 5
promptText: A school board discusses introducing healthier canteen options and possible price changes. Summarize the main points and trade-offs.

title: Summarize Group Discussion — Climate Policy 6
promptText: A panel evaluates carbon pricing versus subsidies for renewable energy adoption. Summarize the rationale behind each approach.

title: Summarize Group Discussion — Product Launch 7
promptText: The marketing team discusses timelines, risks, and messaging for an upcoming product launch. Summarize priorities and risk mitigations.

title: Summarize Group Discussion — Housing Policy 8
promptText: A civic group debates rent control versus incentives for new housing construction. Summarize key arguments and potential compromises.

title: Summarize Group Discussion — Recycling Program 9
promptText: City council members discuss expanding recycling facilities and public education campaigns. Summarize proposed steps and expected outcomes.

title: Summarize Group Discussion — Hospital Staffing 10
promptText: A hospital committee reviews shift scheduling changes to address staff burnout. Summarize the causes identified and recommended actions.

title: Respond — Customer Complaint 1
promptText: You are a store manager. A customer complains that their order arrived late and the packaging was damaged. Apologize and propose a clear resolution.

title: Respond — Roommate Noise 2
promptText: Your roommate plays loud music at night before your exam. Respond politely, explain the situation, and suggest a compromise.

title: Respond — Project Deadline 3
promptText: You realize you cannot meet a project deadline due to unexpected issues. Inform your supervisor, accept responsibility, and propose a realistic plan.

title: Respond — Event Cancellation 4
promptText: An event you organized must be canceled due to safety concerns. Inform participants, provide reasons, and offer next steps or alternatives.

title: Respond — Lost Item 5
promptText: You borrowed a friend’s book and lost it. Apologize sincerely, explain what happened, and propose a fair solution.

title: Respond — Team Conflict 6
promptText: Two teammates disagree on task ownership. Respond as the team lead to clarify roles and maintain a cooperative environment.

title: Respond — Service Feedback 7
promptText: A client provides negative feedback about your service. Thank them, address concerns, and explain how you will improve.

title: Respond — Travel Delay 8
promptText: You will arrive late to an important meeting due to public transport delays. Inform the organizer and propose how to minimize disruption.

title: Respond — Academic Integrity 9
promptText: You notice a group member copying content without citations. Address the issue respectfully and propose corrective steps.

title: Respond — Price Increase 10
promptText: Customers are upset about a recent price increase. Explain the reasons, emphasize value, and offer helpful options.
